title.narrative: PK Sindh Public Sector Management Reform Project

description.narrative: The development objective of the Project is to strengthen public sector performance in the Province of Sindh through improved revenue generation and expenditure management.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Adequacy of Sindh Revenue Board Funding | Description :The Provincial Government shall ensure that, unless theAssociation otherwise agree in writing, the SRB shall receive an annual allocation of resources for its current and developmentexpenditures as agreed in the legal agreements. The Provincial Government shall release the allocated funds to the SRB in a timelymanner. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Appointment of Financial Reporting Officer | Description :The Provincial Government shall recruit/select andhire by no later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, a financial reporting officer to prepare Project-level periodicfinancial reports; review financial and non-financing reports extracted from Sindh's financial management information systems;manage Project disbursements, and coordinate the preparation of audited financial statements. | Due Date :01-Jul-2015

Finance Agreement :Disclosure and Annual Progress Report of PFM and Tax Reforms | Description :The Provincial Governmentmaintain/ensure, throughout the period of Project implementation, the public disclosure, in the FD's website, of the PFM ReformStrategy; the Tax Revenue Mobilization (TRM) Reform Plan, prepare comprehensive annual progress reports on the implementation ofthe PFM Reform Strategy and the TRM Reform Plan and publicly disclose such reports in the FD website. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Grievance Redressal Mechanism | Description :The Provincial Government shall ensure that the FD and SRBestablish by not later than three months after the Effective Date, and maintain throughout the period of Project implementation: a)a procurement documentation and record keeping system, including a publicly accessible website; and b) a system for the handling ofprocurement complaints, both in a manner acceptable to the Association. | Due Date :07-Jan-2015

Finance Agreement :Maintenance of Project Management Unit (PMU) | Description :The Economic Reform Unit, staffed with qualified andexperienced people, will serve as the PMU and will be vested with powers, financial resources, functions and competences, to serveas the focal unit in day-to-day implementation of Project activities in procurement, financial management, monitoring & evaluation,communications & stakeholders awareness and coordination with other agencies. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Maintenance of Tax Reform Unit (TRU) | Description :The Provincial Government shall establish and maintain forthe duration of the Project, a TRU within the FD, with qualified staff, to establish linkages with national and internationalacademic institutions to promote evidence-based tax policy planning and administration. The TRU will conduct at least twenty highquality rigorous sector-based analytical reports on sales tax on pre-approved topics. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) Cell Plans and Financing | Description :The Provincial Government shall causethe M&E cell of the P&DD to prepare, within six months of the Effective Date, and carry out a costed multiyear reform plan for themanagement of a dashboard for investment interventions, including ICT-based field inspections, and proactive beneficiary feedback;and ensure that the cell receives on an annual basis, adequate allocations of financial resources. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Project Steering Committee | Description :The Provincial Government shall establish and maintain during theduration of the project, a Project Steering Committee, headed by ACS, P&DD, in order to periodically review, identify problems andcorrective measures, provide policy guidance, and coordinate inter-departmental efforts, in the implementation of the Project. TheProject Steering Committee shall meet at least twice every fiscal Year. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Sindh Public Procurement Regulatory Authority (SPPRA) Plans and Financing | Description :The ProvincialGovernment will cause SPPRA to prepare, within six (6) months of the Effective Date, and carry out a costed multiyear reform plancovering the adoption and implementation of e-procurement, the establishment of a management information system and a procurementcertification program; and ensure that SPPRA receives on an annual basis, adequate allocations of financial resources. | Frequency:Yearly

Finance Agreement :Sindh Revenue Board Integrity and Dispute Resolution Systems | Description :The Provincial Government shallcause the SRB to establish, within two years of the Effective Date, and maintain throughout the period of Project implementation,an integrity management system, adequate capacity for the carrying out of tax litigation, an independent tax appeal mechanismcomprised of a tax appellate tribunal and alternative dispute resolution procedures. | Due Date :07-Jan-2017

Finance Agreement :Third Party Validations | Description :For purposes of DLIs #2, #3, #7, and #8 set forth in Schedule 3 to theFA, the terms of reference for the consultants to be hired by the Provincial Government for carrying out the third partyverification, audit, validation or analysis required under the respective DLRs, shall have been discussed and agreed with theAssociation irrespective of the source of fund of such consultancies. | Frequency :Yearly
